activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Uriel Sandoval-Mereles

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on February 23, 2023 at 09:00 am.

10:29 AM Defendant Uriel Sandoval-Mereles in court.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds the defendant indigent. Court appoints Attorney Philip Brehm. Defendant to pay $100/month for Attorney fees.
Calendar call scheduled for February 23, 2023 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on October 21, 2022 at 10:15 am.

2:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Uriel Sandoval-Mereles appeared by video. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender. Defendant to file petition for Court appointed attorney. Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by Court, jury trial to be set.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No driving without a valid drivers license or valid insurance.

10:27 AM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Uriel Sandoval-Mereles appeared by video. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond set of $1000.00   with conditions Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No driving without a valid drivers license or valid insurance.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on July 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Criminal Complaint and Summons served on defendant personally on June 17, 2022
